intro: Diaphananthe orientalis, commonly known as the oriental diaphananthe, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
